IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION TO PROVIDE PROFESSIONAL EDUCATION TO STUDENTS TO RECEIVE A GRADUATE DEGREE IN PHARMACY.
IRS990.MissionDescription: STUDENT EDUCATION: TO PROVIDE GRADUATE DEGREE IN PHARMACY.
IRS990.Description: STUDENT EDUCATION : TO PROVIDE STUDENTS WITH INSTRUCTION, BOOKS AND MATERIALS TO OBTAIN GRADUATE DEGREES IN PHARMACY. NUMBER PERSONS ENROLLED: SPRING 1,191, FALL 1,224.

Activity2.Description: STUDENT HOUSING AND PARKING: TO PROVIDE ROOM AND BOARD FOR STUDENTS OF THE ST. LOUIS COLLEGE OF PHARMACY. NUMBER OF PERSONS HOUSED 298, ALSO PROVIDES PARKING FOR 560.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: DESCRIPTION AND USE OF THE ORGANIZATION'S COLLECTIONS
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The mortar and pestle collections are displayed in the college's lobby and library. The items preserve the history of the pharmacy profession for future generations.
The funds are used to further the mission of the College

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: THE COLLEGE POLICY OF RACIAL NONDISCRIMINATION IS PUBLISHED IN ALL ADMISSIONS CATALOGS AND MATERIAL AND MADE AVAILABLE TO ALL PROSPECTIVE STUDENTS.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: THE ORGANIZATION RECEIVES FINANCIAL AID OR ASSISTANCE FROM THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION HIGHER EDUCATION PROGRAMS.

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.TypeOfGrant: COLLEGE CONTRIBUTION OJ CLOUGHLY LN FD

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedures for monitoring the use of grant funds in the United States
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: The student grants and awards are financial aid funds which the financial aid ofYice has determined each student was eligible to receive. The business office reviews their list, prior to entering the awards directly on each student's tuition account, as payment. Financial aid office is provided monthly reports as these awards are expensed out of the financial aid budget. Students are aware of these awards through various publications. Students have direct access to all details of their tuition account.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Identifier: HEALTH OR SOCIAL CLUB DUES OR INITIATION FEES
Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: THOMAS F PATTON, THE PRESIDENT IS THE ONLY INDIVIDUAL THAT RECEIVED PAYMENT FOR HEALTH/SOCIAL CLUB MEMBERSHIP DUES. THE PRESIDENT PAID THE COLLEGE FOR HIS PERSONAL USE.

THE FOLLOWING INDIVIDUALS RECEIVED THE NON-FIXED PAYMENT. THOMAS F PATTON, PRESIDENT Gary G Torrence, VP FINANCE & CFO, Wendy C Duncan, Dean, Kimberly J Kilgore, Dean, Gloria J Vertrees, VP Enrollment Services, F Chad Shepherd, VP Information Technology & CIO

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1: HLTH & ED FACILITIES AUTHORITY OF THE STATE OF MO

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, QUESTION 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The staff members that provide information to the outside return preparer conduct a thorough review of a draft of the return. The final version is reviewed by the Finance Committee of the Board and then presented to the full Board prior to filing.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: COMPLIANCE WITH CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: OFFICERS, DIRECTORS OR TRUSTEES ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE ANNUALLY INTERESTS THAT COULD GIVE RISE TO CONFLICTS. ALL CONTRACTS AND PURCHASES IN EXCESS OF $1,000 REQUIRE THE APPROVAL OF CFO. THE PRESIDENTS APPROVAL IS REQUIRED FOR $5,000 AND ABOVE. ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS ARE REVIEWED AS PART OF THE APPROVAL PROCESS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A/B
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: DURING 2009 THE BOARD COMMENCED A PRESIDENTAL SEARCH. AS PART OF THE PROCESS INFORMATION WAS GATHERED FROM THE RECRUITING FIRM. A REVIEW OF 990'S FOR SIMILAR SCHOOLS WAS CONDUCTED AND INFORMATION WAS GATHERED FROM THE JOURNAL OF HIGHER EDUCATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: PROCESS FOR MAKING DOCUMENTS AVAILABLE TO PUBLIC
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available to the public upon request.
